info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 5:48AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF SNOW WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT PARTS OF NEW HAVEN, FAIRFIELD AND EASTERN SUFFOLK COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of snow accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. An additional few tenths of an inch of snow is possible in this band. Motorists are advised to use extra caution this morning as untreated roads will be snow and ice covered. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 538 AM EDT, a northwest to southeast oriented narrow band of snow was nearly stationary across New Haven and eastern Suffolk Counties. This band may drift slowly south over the next hour and a half. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... New Haven, Waterbury, Milford, Wallingford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Guilford, Southold, Southbury, Clinton, Old Saybrook, Durham, Mattituck, Southampton and Sag Harbor. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
